tr: (craps) a first roll of 7 or 11 that immediately wins the stake
a notation cancelling a previous sharp or flat
someone regarded as certain to succeed
example: he's a natural for the job

tr: existing in or produced by nature
existing in or in conformity with nature or the observable world
(of a musical note) being neither raised nor lowered by one chromatic semitone
functioning or occurring in a normal way
example: it's the natural thing to happen
a grandparent's natural affection for a grandchild

tr: (used especially of commodities) being unprocessed or manufactured using only simple or minimal processes
prompted by (or as if by) instinct
example: a cat's natural aversion to water
offering to help was as instinctive as breathing

partsOfSpeech.dec: educat(e) 教育 + -ion 行为,状态 + -al ...的
inter- 在…之间,相互 + nation n.民族 + -al ...的
ab- 离去,相反 + norm 规则 + -al ...的

partsOfSpeech.d: 随意的，任选的，可选择的，非强制的
partsOfSpeech.dec: opt- 选择 + -ion 名词后缀 + -al ...的

partsOfSpeech.d: 至关重要的，必不可少的

partsOfSpeech.dec: con- 共同, 一起 + vent 来 + -ion 行为,状态 + -al ...的
gram 写,记录 + -m- + -atic 具备...性质 + -al ...的

partsOfSpeech.d: 东方(尤指中国和日本)的

partsOfSpeech.dec: prin- 第一,主要的 + cip- 拿,抓 + -al ...的
rat 推定,理由 + -ion 行为,状态 + -al ...的
tri- 三 + vi 道路 + -al ...的
skeptic n.持怀疑态度的人 + -al ...的
em- 使... + pir- 尝试,冒险 + -ic 人/学科 + -al ...的
medi- 中间 + ev 年龄,寿命,时代,时期 + -al ...的
mun 功能 + -i- + cip 拿,抓住,获取 + -al ...的

data.enText: in nature
existing in nature; not made or caused by humans
natural disasters
the natural world (= of trees, rivers, animals and birds)
a country's natural resources (= its coal, oil, forests, etc.)
wildlife in its natural habitat
data.chText: 自然栖息地里的野生动植物

data.enText: natural yogurt (= with no flavour added)
My hair soon grew back to its natural colour (= after being dyed ) .
data.chText: 我的头发很快又恢复了本色。

data.enText: The clothes are available in warm natural colours.
data.chText: 这些衣服有各种自然的暖色调可供挑选。

data.enText: expected
normal; as you would expect
data.chText: 正常的；自然的；意料之中的

data.enText: to die of natural causes (= not by violence, but normally, of old age)
He thought social inequality was all part of the natural order of things.
data.chText: 他认为社会不平等完全合乎事物的自然规律。

data.enText: She was the natural choice for the job.
data.chText: 做那份工作，她是当然人选。

data.enText: behaviour
used to describe behaviour that is part of the character that a person or an animal was born with
data.chText: 天生的；本能的；与生俱来的

data.enText: the natural agility of a cat
the natural processes of language learning
It's only natural to worry about your children.
data.chText: 为孩子操心是很自然的。

data.enText: ability
having an ability that you were born with
data.chText: 天赋的；天生具有某种能力的

data.enText: He's a natural leader.
relaxed
relaxed and not pretending to be sb/sth different
data.chText: 不拘束的；不做作的；自然的

data.enText: It's difficult to look natural when you're feeling nervous.
data.chText: 当你紧张的时候，就很难显得轻松自然。

data.enText: parents/children
related by blood
His natural mother was unable to care for him so he was raised by an aunt.
data.chText: 他的生母不能照顾他，所以他是姑姑抚养大的。

data.enText: born to parents who are not married
or
She was a natural daughter of King James II.
data.chText: 她是国王詹姆斯二世的私生女。

data.enText: based on human reason
based on human reason alone
data.chText: 符合人的理性的；正常的；自然的

data.enText: natural justice/law
in music
used after the name of a note to show that the note is neither sharp nor flat . The written symbol is (♮).
data.chText: 本位音的，标有还原号的（书写符号为♮）

data.enText: B natural
person
a person who is very good at sth without having to learn how to do it, or who is perfectly suited for a particular job
data.chText: 有天赋的人；擅长做某事的人

data.enText: She took to flying like a natural.
data.chText: 她迷上了飞行，仿佛天生就会似的。

data.enText: He's a natural for the role.
data.chText: 他是这个角色的最佳人选。

data.enText: in music
a normal musical note, not its sharp or flat form. The written symbol is (♮).
data.chText: 本位音，还原音，本位号（书写符号为 ♮）

word_means: 本位音的，标有还原号的

means: 本位音的，标有还原号的（书写符号为♮）
本位音，还原音，本位号(书写符号为 ♮)

ex.enText: This is a natural phenomenon that happens about once a century.
ex.chText: 这是一种自然现象，几乎每个世纪都要发生一次。

ex.enText: She cooks with natural ingredients only.
ex.chText: 她做饭只用纯天然的佐料。

synonyms.bx: 指存在或发生于自然界的，含非人力所为之意，也指食物没有添加其他成分的。

ex.enText: Gasoline is made from crude oil.
ex.chText: 汽油是从原油中提炼出来的。

ex.enText: They imported crude rubber from Malaysia.
ex.chText: 他们从马来西亚进口生胶。

synonyms.bx: 主要指石油、橡胶等未经化学加工、尚处于自然状态的，只作定语。

ex.enText: The factory is in frequent scarcity of raw materials.
ex.chText: 这家工厂经常原料不足。

ex.enText: He also imported raw cotton from America in his own ships.
ex.chText: 他也用自己的船从美国进口原棉。

synonyms.bx: 指物质未经加工、依然处于自然状态的。

ex.chText: 未提炼的猪油/原糖/未精制的糖浆

synonyms.bx: 指物质处于天然或未经精炼状态的，通常含有其他杂质。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：自然的，天然的

example.ex: It is only natural for youngsters to crave the excitement of driving a fast car...
example.tran: 年轻人追求开快车的刺激是太正常不过的事情。

example.ex: It is only natural that he should resent you...
example.tran: 他怨恨你是很自然的事。

example.ex: A period of depression can be a perfectly natural response to certain aspects of life.
example.tran: 某段时间感到抑郁可能是对生活某些方面很正常的反应。

value.def: If you say that it is natural for someone to act in a particular way or for something to happen in that way, you mean that it is reasonable in the circumstances.
value.tran: 自然的;正常的;合乎常情的

example.ex: ...the insect's natural instinct to feed...
example.tran: 昆虫进食的本能

example.ex: Anger is the natural reaction we experience when we feel threatened or frustrated.
example.tran: 我们觉得受到威胁或遭受挫折时本能地会感到气愤。

value.def: Natural behaviour is shared by all people or all animals of a particular type and has not been learned.
value.tran: (行为)出于本性的，生来就有的

example.ex: She has a natural ability to understand the motives of others...
example.tran: 她有一种洞察他人动机的天赋。

example.ex: He had a natural flair for business.
example.tran: 他有做生意的天分。

value.def: Someone with a natural ability or skill was born with that ability and did not have to learn it.

example.ex: He's a natural with any kind of engine...
example.tran: 他天生就会摆弄各种发动机。

example.ex: She proved to be a natural on camera.
example.tran: 事实证明她在镜头前很有表演天赋。

value.def: If you say that someone is a natural, you mean that they do something very well and very easily.

example.ex: Bethan's sister was as friendly and natural as the rest of the family...
example.tran: 贝唐的妹妹和她家的其他人一样友好、随意。

example.ex: Hannah's natural manner reassured her, and she relaxed.
example.tran: 汉娜轻松自然的举止消除了她的疑虑，于是她放松了下来。

value.def: If someone's behaviour is natural, they appear to be relaxed and are not trying to hide anything.
value.tran: 轻松自如的;不局促的;不做作的

example.ex: For pictures of people behaving naturally, not posing for the camera, it is essential to shoot unnoticed...
example.tran: 要拍出不专门摆姿势、举止自然的人物照片，抓拍是关键。

example.ex: She is magnificent at making you feel you can talk quite naturally to her.
example.tran: 她很了不起，能让你感觉可以自然随意地和她交谈。

example.ex: The critics praised the reality of the scenery and the naturalness of the acting.
example.tran: 评论家称赞了舞台布景的现实逼真和表演的真实自然。

example.ex: It has called the typhoon the worst natural disaster in South Korea in many years...
example.tran: 它称这次台风为韩国多年来最严重的自然灾害。

example.ex: The gigantic natural harbour of Poole is a haven for boats.
example.tran: 巨型天然港普尔港是船只的避风港。

value.def: Natural things exist or occur in nature and are not made or caused by people.
value.tran: 非人为的;自然的;天然的

example.ex: Nitrates are chemicals that occur naturally in water and the soil...
example.tran: 硝酸盐是水和土壤中自然存在的化学物质。

example.ex: Honey is a naturally acidic substance.
example.tran: 蜂蜜是天然的酸性物质。

example.ex: She has been reunited with her natural mother...
example.tran: 她和亲生母亲团聚了。

example.ex: His commitments to the stepchildren will not reduce his obligation to his natural children.
example.tran: 他对继子女的关爱和投入不会减少他对亲生孩子的责任。

value.def: Someone's natural parent is their biological father or mother, as opposed to an adult who is looking after them or has adopted them. Someone's natural child is their biological son or daughter, as opposed to a child they are looking after or have adopted.
value.tran: (父母或子女)亲生的，有血缘关系的

example.ex: ...B natural. B
example.tran: 本位音

example.ex: Is that F a natural or a sharp?
example.tran: 那个F是本位音还是升半音？

value.def: In music, a natural note is the ordinary note, not its sharp or flat form.
value.tran: (音符)本位音的，标有还原号的

example.ex: According to the Home Office, your brother died of natural causes...
example.tran: 根据内政部的调查，你哥哥属正常死亡。

example.ex: A prisoner collapsed and died yesterday, apparently from natural causes.
example.tran: 一名囚犯昨天突然倒下死了，看上去像是正常死亡。

value.def: If someone dies of or from natural causes, they die because they are ill or old rather than because of an accident or violence.

trans: 自然语言(自然发展而成，并非人造)
固有（自然、振动）频率；缩写词为nat.freg.
